greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of lim n -> infinity A001699(n)^(1/2^n).
reference: Steven R. Finch, Mathematical Constants, Cambridge University Press, 2003, Section 6.10 Quadratic recurrence constants, p. 443.
link: A. De Mier, M. Noy, On the maximum number of cycles in outerplanar and series-parallel graphs, El. Notes Discr. Math. 34 (2009) 489-493, Proposition 2.2.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Quadratic Recurrence Equation
mathematica: digits = 105; Clear[b, beta]; b[0] = 1; b[n_] := b[n] = b[n-1]^2 + 1; b[10]; beta[n_] := beta[n] = b[n]^(2^(-n)); beta[5]; beta[n = 6]; While[ RealDigits[beta[n], 10, digits+5] != RealDigits[beta[n-1], 10, digits+5], Print["n = ", n]; n = n+1]; RealDigits[beta[n], 10, digits] // First (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 18 2014 *)
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Dec 01 2002
